comment: Vanilla and brown sugar on the nose. Light fruit and berries on the palate.

A young and bratty 14 year taken early, the smoke is very dominant on the taste in a good way and you don’t acclimate to it, with a buttery biscuit smoothness. Banana, citrus and apples dominate the nose which quickly more into a Smokey finish. Oban mastery.

Simply one of the best single malts money can buy.  I regret not bringing home a few bottles from our last visit to the distillery.
Indescribably smooth and complex, with just the right amount of richness and sweetness to be the perfect after dinner dram.
